alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; North Cass; Northern Aitkin; South Cass (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN AITKIN, CENTRAL CASS AND NORTHEASTERN CROW WING COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 527 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Boy River, to 7 miles northwest of Longville, to near Walker, to 6 miles south of Laporte, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Longville and Woman Lake around 540 PM CDT. Hackensack around 545 PM CDT. Wabedo around 550 PM CDT. Backus around 555 PM CDT. Emily, Fifty Lakes and Outing around 600 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Boy Lake, Lake Roosevelt, Pheasant Lake, Washburn Lake, Lake Ada, White Elk Lake, Ten Mile Lake, Thunder Lake, Swanburg and Whipholt. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Crow Wing; North Cass; Northern Aitkin; South Cass
